channel.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor
channel.description:
Hooking MutableString/RSString/StringWrapper easily ConstantUtf8 "invalid char" ConstantUtf8 "java/io/UnsupportedEncodingException" ConstantUtf8 "java/net/MalformedURLException" ConstantUtf8 "ISO-8859-1" ConstantMethodref java.awt.FontMetrics stringWidth (Ljava/lang/String;)I Method String toString() Method int hashCode()
Hooking CacheUnpacker/Decompressor ConstantUtf8 "java/lang/RuntimeException" ConstantUtf8 "Invalid GZIP header!" ConstantUtf8 "Invalid GZIP compressed data!" Fieldref java.lang.Boolean TYPE Fieldref java.lang.Float TYPE etc.. Methodref java.util.zip.Inflater inflate ([B)I
Use those and it should be no problem.

item.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

If you look at the updater outputs posted, you can hook it without being to smart about the client

Read full topic

item.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

well sharing knowledge isnt all about “do this here, then do that, this is how it works”, you can also share knowledge by sharing source code, there quite a few low-profile bots around, they might not be that good for autoing, but you can learn a lot from it, make your own or improve.
with programming in general, i learnt a lot from reading other peoples source code

Read full topic
item.source: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor

item.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:6, topic:156419”]With every post of hook information you run the risk, albeit small, of them finding what you use to hook and patching the game accordingly.

Sometimes keeping your mouth shut and sharing information in smaller circles is more beneficial than posting for the single reason of raising your own perceived reputation.[/quote]

Of course the only problem is these small circles consist of about 2 or 3 people whom are all, already informed and very knowledgeable of the client. Perhaps if the community member section was used more then I’d agree with you but at the moment the sharing of knowledge is so minimal one might say it’s non-existent.

Read full topic
item.source: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor

item.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor

item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:9, topic:156419”][quote author=semaphore link=topic=213398.msg1864144#msg1864144 date=1194114655]
With every post of hook information you run the risk, albeit small, of them finding what you use to hook and patching the game accordingly.

Sometimes keeping your mouth shut and sharing information in smaller circles is more beneficial than posting for the single reason of raising your own perceived reputation.
[/quote]This is why we can’t have nice things.[/quote]
Exactly, and it’s quite sad

[quote=“semaphore, post:6, topic:156419”]With every post of hook information you run the risk, albeit small, of them finding what you use to hook and patching the game accordingly.

Sometimes keeping your mouth shut and sharing information in smaller circles is more beneficial than posting for the single reason of raising your own perceived reputation.[/quote]

item.title: Simple method to find MutableString & Decompressor
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

Hooking MutableString/RSString/StringWrapper easily
ConstantUtf8 “invalid char”
ConstantUtf8 “java/io/UnsupportedEncodingException”
ConstantUtf8 “java/net/MalformedURLException”
ConstantUtf8 “ISO-8859-1”
ConstantMethodref java.awt.FontMetrics stringWidth (Ljava/lang/String;)I
Method String toString()
Method int hashCode()

Hooking CacheUnpacker/Decompressor
ConstantUtf8 “java/lang/RuntimeException”
ConstantUtf8 “Invalid GZIP header!”
ConstantUtf8 “Invalid GZIP compressed data!”
Fieldref java.lang.Boolean TYPE
Fieldref java.lang.Float TYPE
etc…
Methodref java.util.zip.Inflater inflate ([B)I

Use those and it should be no problem.
